title: 'Deloitte 2023 Financial Services Industry Predictions': Generative AI, Carbon Offset Financing, Driverless Vehicles ... - PR Newswire
summary: Deloitte's report on financial services industry predictions for the next decade highlights the impact of data, emerging technologies, products and services, and climate change on the future of financial services and society. Some key trends include the potential of generative AI to boost productivity, increasing demand for carbon credit offset financing, and the need for insurers to prepare for driverless vehicles. Embedded insurance, real-time B2B payments, and the rise of quantum computing are also expected to shape the industry.

greenwashing: The article does not mention greenwashing.

title: Sustainability Matters: Carhartt Expands Resale Program to More Stores + More News - Footwear News
summary: Sustainability-focused news for the footwear industry: Carhartt expands its in-store trade-in program; Capri Holdings partners with NFWF to improve leather-sourcing sustainability; Dahsheng Chemical introduces eco-friendly insole made with 20% spent coffee grounds; La Sportiva North America becomes Climate Neutral Certified; Softstar Shoes certified as a B Corp; PrimaLoft creates new insulation made with Ocean Bound Plastic; GoldToe Socks launches Free Recycling Program with TerraCycle; OrthoLite and Novamont collaborate on circular foam material solution for footwear; Oboz achieves B Corp certification; Stride Rite unveils eco-conscious kids' sneakers made with seaweed fiber and recycled rubber; Renfro Brands selects TrusTrace to support traceability efforts; J.Crew launches resale program with ThredUp and curated vintage collection; Rack Room Shoes partners with Sneaker Impact for sneaker recycling program.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, and nature and wildlife conservation.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes products and processes that are new or improved compared to the firm's previous products or processes, and that have been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.

title: Gipsy Hill launches offset-free carbon negative beers - The Grocer
summary: Gipsy Hill Brewery has launched two beers, Swell Lager and Trail Pale, that are claimed to be carbon negative without the need for offsetting schemes. The beers are made using barley grown using regenerative practices and recaptured hops. The carbon footprint for a pint of Swell Lager is –40g carbon dioxide equivalent (CO2e) and –30g CO2e for a pint of Trail Pail, as verified by Zevero, a carbon accounting firm.
green_innovation: TRUE. The beers are made using barley grown using regenerative practices and recaptured hops, which reduces their environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE. The beers are made using a new brewing process that reduces their carbon footprint.
green_product: TRUE. The beers are made using environmentally friendly practices and have a low carbon footprint.
green_process: TRUE. The beers are made using a new brewing process that reduces their carbon footprint.
